contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Media 04.jpg|thumb|Aerial view of the Quaraí, or Cuareim River]] The '''Quaraí''' or '''Cuareim River''' ([[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] '''Rio Quaraí''', [[Spanish language|Spanish]] '''Río Cuareim'''<ref>{{GEOnet2|32FA883A2D7A3774E0440003BA962ED3|Río Cuareim}}</ref>) is a [[tributary]] of the [[Uruguay River]]. ==Location== The river originates in the [[Coxilha de Santana]] (Spanish ''Cuchilla de Santa Ana''), an area of low-lying hills, and runs westward to join the Uruguay River. It forms the boundary between [[Uruguay]] on the south and [[Rio Grande do Sul]] state of [[Brazil]] on the north. ==Border dispute== There is a long-standing and unresolved border dispute between [[Uruguay]] and [[Brazil]] along part of Quaraí River. However, this is not seen as a politically disturbing issue between the two countries. ==See also== * [[List of rivers of Uruguay]] * [[List of rivers of Rio Grande do Sul]] *[[Brazilian Island]] * [[Masoller#Uruguayan-Brazilian border dispute]] * [[Geography of Uruguay#Topography and hydrography]] {{coord|30|11|5|S|57|36|18|W|type:river_region:BR_dim:20km|display=title|notes=<ref>[[GEOnet Names Server|GNS]] coordinates adjusted using [[Google Maps]], and [http://tools.freeside.sk/geolocator/geolocator.html GeoLocator]</ref>}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Quarai River}} [[Category:Rivers of Rio Grande do Sul]] [[Category:Rivers of Uruguay]] [[Category:Brazil–Uruguay border]] [[Category:Territorial disputes of Brazil]] [[Category:Territorial disputes of Uruguay]] [[Category:International rivers of South America]] {{RioGrandedoSul-geo-stub}} {{Uruguay-geo-stub}}
